name: Marimokkori
description: The name 'Marimokkori' is a portmanteau: marimo is the word for the green algae clusters that grow in some of Hokkaidō's lakes, while mokkori, literally 'bulge', is a Japanese slang term for an erection.

name: Melon-kuma
description: A bear with a yubari melon on its head.

name: Kyun-chan
description: Kyun-chan is a northern pika, a small furry rabbit-like animal (ezo naki usagi) found only in Hokkaido. He's really shy and that's why wears a Hokkaido deer hat (ezo shika) to hide his shyness.

name: IburiOne Jr.
description: A pink dog

name: Kiko-chan
description: A red bull

name: Kazumo-chan
description: A piece of herring roe

name: Ikaaru Seijin
description: The Man from Planet Ikaaru, an alien squid

name: Jingis Khan No Jin-Kun
japanese: ジンギスカンのジンくん
description: Jingis Khan represents a local delicacy by the same name, which is a cook-it-yourself dish including mutton

name: Nipo-kun
description: A mascot modeled on a traditional toy made by the local Ainu tribes.

name: Sarupu
description: A monkey with a scallop crown and a cow-print onesie. He weighs the same as 90 scallops.

name: Laveton
description: A pig dressed in lavendar.  Kamifurano is famous for both lavendar and pork.

name: Soraisu
description: A sky blue squirrel with cloud hair.

name: Milkuman
description: A bear with an ice cream cone on his head.

name: Frep the Fox
japanese: フレップ・ザ・フォックス
mascot: The Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters Baseball Team
description: An Ezo red fox, who debuted in March 2016. He is gray with red markings, and he is considered an 'apprentice.'

name: Polly Polaris
mascot: The Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters Baseball Team
description: A brown squirrel who appeared late 2012, at the same time when the Fighters announced their 10th season. She's the first female mascot that was introduced to the team.

name: Cubby the Bear
mascot: The Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters Baseball Team
description: a brown bear and younger brother of B·B. He appeared in 2006 as the mascot of the Fighters' minor league team, based in Kamagaya, Chiba. Cubby and B·B performed for each team, but also sometimes perform together when the Fighters' professional team plays in Tokyo.

name: B.B. (Brisky the Bear)
mascot: The Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters Baseball Team
description: A black bear with a ruffle of black or orange hair on his head. He first appeared in 2004, as the successor to Fighty. When B·B was first introduced, his appearance was criticized by some of the Fighters' supporters for being too Americanized. On the Fighters official website, B·B has his own picture gallery and column.

name: Fighty
mascot: The Hokkaido Nippon-Ham Fighters Baseball Team
description: A bright pink pterodactyl whose head resembled a giant leg of ham and who sometimes rode a bicycle around the field. Fighty was retired, despite the (unsuccessful) 'Save Fighty' campaign, when the Fighters moved to Hokkaido.

name: TV Tosan
description: The Sapporo TV Tower, with a mustache

name: Moko
mascot: The Japanese Self Defense Force - Hokkaido
description: A sheep with a cute camouflage bowtie.

name: Kibicchi
description: A walking ear of corn that represents Odori Park, a park full of carts of fresh corn

name: Kiyotchi
description: His abstract art hat is the local logo, a K for Kiyota.

name: Kappon
description: His full name is “Jozankei Kappa Kokichibei”. One day, he was playing with his friends on the banks of the Toyohira River with a bucket that had floated downstream, and shouting out “kappon!” he squeezed himself into the bucket and couldn’t get back out. From that day, everyone called him ‘Kappon’! Kappon loves hot springs and always brings his own towel and bucket with him, because he thinks it’s convenient to bring them to the hot springs himself.

name: Ezomon
description: A Hokkaido flying squirrel

name: Dole-kun
description: Modeled on the Blakiston's Fish Owl -- the largest owl in Japan and a very well-known denizen of Hokkaido.

name: Matagi no Momiji-chan
japanese: またぎのもみじちゃん
description: A gun toting pink yezo sika deer, often seen with Jingis Khan No Jin-Kun

name: Ikube
description: He is a blue traveling fairy who fell in love with Aomori prefecture after wandering around Japan. Because of this love, he decided to live in Aomori (which means 'blue forest')

name: Wanko
description: Inspired by a 'wanko soba' noodle, a famous local food in Iwate prefecture. Wanko consists of 5 brothers, each of them has a different motif and character.

name: Musubimaru
description: A rice ball samurai. Rice is famous produce in Miyagi and its armor design comes after the local hero'Masamune Date'

name: Sugitchi
description: An Akita cedar tree, retired in 2017 after 10 years of service

name: Kizakura Sui
japanese: 黄桜すいプロジェクト
description: A 16-year-old water goddess that is 158 centimeters tall and likes the Akita Komachi variety of rice, soft serve ice cream, and cats

name: Kitekeru-kun
description: This mascot is overshadowed by Kumamons popularity.

name: Kibitan
description: Based on the local 'Kibitaki' bird (the narcissus flycatcher). He was originally created for a nineties athletics event and now represents hopeful renewal for Fukushima.

name: Hustle Komon
description: A character inspired by the long-running TV period drama, Mito Komon.

name: Tochimarukun
description: A little hard worker

name: Gunma-chan
description: A cute pony from Gunma prefecture

name: Kobaton
description: The mascot of Saitama prefecture, Kobaton is a Eurasian collared dove, which is also the prefectural bird. Kobaton was made originally as the mascot of the fifty-ninth annual national athletic meeting held in the prefecture in 2004, and was inaugurated as mascot of the prefecture in 2005 with an inauguration ceremony and a letter of appointment from the governor. A wheelchair-using version of Kobaton also exists.

name: Saimachi
description: Works as a mascot for Saitama Prefecture along with Kobaton.  Some consider Saimachi to be Kobatons rival.

name: Chiba-kun
description: A mysterious red animal from Chiba Prefecture whose shape comes from the geography of the prefecture

name: Reruhi-San
description: TThe 270cm-tall skiing mascot based on Theodor Von-Lerch, an Austro-Hungarian major who brought the skiing to Japan

name: Hyakumansan
description: 'Mr. One Million', generally unpopular because he is considered to be ugly

name: Sautan
description: A dinosaur, meant to represent the many dinosaur fossils found in Fukui.  Part of the Juratic mascot group.

name: Hishimaru Takeda
description: A member of the Takeda clan

name: Arukuma
description: A walking bear with an Nagano apple hat.  Arukuma won first place in the 2019 Yuru Chara Grand Prix.

name: Minamo
description: A smiling sprite

name: Fujippi
description: If Mt Fuji was a person

name: Kappasalamander
description: A hybrid of a kappa and an axolotl.

name: Mametan
description: A walking bean pod

name: Haropon
description: A racoon dog witch

name: Omozo
description: A square elephant

name: Ringori-kun
description: A mix of a baby gorilla and an apple

name: Bun-chan
description: A monkey with a newspaper hat

name: Bun-chan
mascot: Bunkaru, a PR website run by Japan's Agency for Cultural Affairs
description: A rosy cheeked mascot

name: Haniwa Kacho / Haniwa Bucho
description: An office manager with the head of an ancient clay figure

name: Swatch
description: A patchwork elephant that is a reincarnation of Suwako, an elephant that once lived in the zoo

name: Kuroneko Shironeko
description: A black cat and white cat serve as mascots for Yamato Transport Company.  These cats are represented in various illustrations including the famous Kuroneko logo of a mom cat carrying a baby cat.

name: Paiko-chan
description: A terrifyingly sexual pink bird

name: Pay-kun
description: A credit card weilding squirrel, he serves as the mascot for Payment Navi, a Japanese credit card information site

name: Hanako
description: A white elephant nurse

name: Zombear
description: He’s a big stuffed teddy bear who has been wandering the streets of Hokkaido for 70 years looking for the boy that owns him. He’s got a very bad sense of direction, but is lucky nonetheless.

name: Ponta
description: A racoon dog, the official mascot for the Ponta Points program through Lawson

name: Nanaco
description: A giraffe, the official mascot for the Nanaco rewards program and payment service through 7-Eleven

name: Asaga-Ossan
description: An old man who loves booze and has a morning glory flower for a head.

name: Dennyas
description: Three cats that represent Dennys

name: Shugar
description: A cross between a polar bear and a sugar cube.

name: Rippy
description: A rabbit often mistaken for a hamster

name: Psychedelhi-san
description: A mildly racist Indian psychidelic mushroom.  Chosen in a contest that included over 890 designs, it is truly unknown to us why this one was picked.

name: Tomato Ninjen
description: A weird tomato, also the mascot of Kouenji.  Usually appears with Psychedelhi-san

name: Kawacchi
description: A philosophical kappa

name: Sunna-chan
description: A smiling coral fairy

name: Takausagi
description: A grumpy hybrid of a rabbit and a falcon

name: Coppel-kun
description: A flamboyant Danish seagull

name: Hummer-kun
description: A seagull with shades

name: Inunakin
description: A hero dog.  He won 2nd place in the 2019 Yuru-Chara Grand Prix.

name: Manmoshi
mascot: East Nippon Expressway Safe Driving in the Snow
description: A wooly mammoth who teaches the people of Japan how to safely drive in snow.

name: Manbe-kun
description: A boy with crab claws, scallop ears, and an iris for hair.

name: Ono-kun
description: A sockey monkey mascot modeled after the event when citizens sewed toys out of socks to help raise funds to rebuild the city after an earthquake.

name: Komoshika
description: A wide-eyed Japanese serow with wild rice stems for horns and naruto fish cakes for cheeks.  He is said to inhabit Mt. Gozaisho.

name: Gosshi
description: A carp possessed by the soul of a dead soldier (who happens to wear stockings and high heels).  The stars on its head represent the star shape of Goryokaku Park.

name: Super Hakuto-kun
description: A boxing bunny mixed with a train car.

name: Jacu-jii
description: Hybrid of an old man and the faucet of a jacuzzi.

name: Purea
description: A raindrop who fell from the sky and ended up at the water treatment facility.

name: Anameshiusu & Tororinu
japanese: とろりーぬ＆アナメシウス
mascot: Tamano Ontama Meshi, a meal consisting of eel, rice, and a poached egg.
description: Created to represent Tamano Ontama Meshi all around the country, Anameshiusu is an eel fairy that wears the bird mascot Tororinu on its head.

name: Baron Ciste
description: An ammonite-headed gentleman trickster who likes chess, riddles, opera, and fine wines.

name: Mukaron
description: Mukaron has a melon head being bit by a dinosaur, a dried smelt in his hand, and a lettuce bag.

name: Tsubaki Yamae Kurihira
description: A chesnut mixed with a bear.

name: Nebatchi
description: A sentient potato. Nebatchi loves taking naps and sumo wrestling.

name: Chico-chan
mascot: 'Dont Sleep Through Life' quiz show and as an ambassador for women's participation in sports
description: A 5-year-old girl who scolds adults for not knowing the answers to simple but perplexing questions about life.

name: Komapon
description: A cross between a tanuki and a samurai named Yoshinobu Minamoto.

name: Sudachi-kun
description: One of Japans oldest mascots, he is a sentient sudachi citrus fruit.

name: Makibe
description: An angry hedge

name: Hinumaru-kun
description: A green fairy who loves nature.

name: Midorin
description: A forest sprite whose special skill is photosynthesis. The cheeks are designed with purple petals of “Silane”, a Midori-ku flower.

name: Uzutama-kun
description: A fairy that lives at Dazai Junior High School in Kyoto.  Uzutama-kun came dead last in the 2019 Yuru Chara Grand Prix.

name: Korou-kun
description: Korou-kun has Kikuchi Castle on his head.  Korou-kun also won 3rd place in the 2019 Yuru-Chara Grand Prix.

name: Takinomichi Yuzuru
description: A yuzu that promotes Minoh Citys natural sights.

name: Antarou
description: Antarou was born and raised in the Yasuda River.  He wears a kite on his back and a local costume.

name: Tosakenpi
description: A dog with the local Harimaya-bashi bridge on his head.  He loves sumo.

name: Chachamaru
description: A bunny with mino ichiba leaves for ears and cherry blossom decorations.

name: Echigon
description: A yellow demon who represents Amagaski City.

name: Kurupa
description: A kappa born in the Chikugo River, he is the advertising manager for Kurume City

name: Okazaemon
description: Okazaemon originally appeared in the Okazaki Art & Jazz Festival in 2012 but became popular. Okazaemon was declared the Minister of Public Affairs for Okazaki Art in 2013.

name: Omapyon
description: An antelope featuring the northern Alps on its head.

name: Victoire Cheval Blanc Murao III
japanese: ヴィクトワール・シュヴァルブラン・村男Ⅲ世
description: Born from the Pegasus Meteor Shower, he commemorates the 100th anniverary of skiing in Hakuba.  It's wings are handmaid, and therefor cannot fly.

name: Toyonon
description: A dandelion that blooms in the Toyonomachi countryside.

name: Midomosu
description: A 35,000 year old mammoth.  He was found in the Iwajuku ruins.

name: Saigo Tsun
description: Saigo Takomori's dog Tsun.  He was an influential samurai from Satsumasendai.

name: Ragamaru
description: An alien who resembles a dog, made to promote rugby in Japan.

name: Zaosama
description: Born and lives in Zao Forest. He is shy and lives alone as the King.

name: Yokojiro
description: A japanese white eye bird with a cedar tree on his chest.  His hat is shaped like a local mountain.  The flower he holds in his beak is a gift for his wife.

name: Keyaki
description: Originally introduced in 2001 for the Come on Miyagi campaign, Keyaki is designed as a keaki tree which Miyagi prefecture is known for.  He had quietly retired but has gained enough popularity that he ranked in the top 20 for the 2019 Yuru-Chara Grand Prix.

name: Unagiimo no Unamo
description: A mysterious creature harvested after cultivating sweet potatoes using eel.  The head is a sweet potato, the body an eel, and the mustache a plain boring mustache.

name: Fluffy Tamako
description: A rice fairy loved by everyone. She also wears a hydrangea on her head.

name: Kuroshiokun
description: A north-flowing Pacific Ocean current that touches Kochi Prefecture.

name: Mei-Hime
description: An eternal princess who is good at dancing.  Thought to have an affiliation with the Shinto god Ameratsu.

name: Misabo
description: A two month old wild boar child.  His hat is shaked like Enokawa and he has a badge in the shape of Nobiki Bridge.

name: Kyabettsusan
mascot: Supporter of Moms in Nishitokyo City
description: A hybrid of a cat and a cabbage.  She is known for singing and generally exists to make child-rearing more fun.

name: Ukipii
description: A sentient persimmon.

name: Ainosuke
description: A kind hearted indigo merchant.

name: Mamekichi
mascot: Okazaki City Health and Food Education
description: A naughty legume who works to promote health in Okazaki City.

name: Kakitan
description: A persimmon bear that works as a PR representative for the Kikita Kawakami Arigricultural Cooperative in Wakayama prefecture.

name: Utou
description: Based on the folk tale 'Zenichi Tosu'.  He is an odu bird with three children.

name: Director Matsushige
description: A rabbit from the moon who became a prisoner while obeserving Earth from the Moon.  He wears a sweet potato colored suit with a chesnut tree bag and a crysanthemum pinned to his jacket.

name: Ozumin
description: A sheep whose job it is to promote Izumiostu, the best blanket town in Japan.

name: Okechan
description: A safflower in a kimono.

name: Ukedon
description: A rice fairy bown in Namie Town, who lives in a bowl of salmon and fish cakes.

name: Saburo Asahina
description: Based on a warrior from the 13th century by the same name.

name: Matsuhime Mappy
description: A fairy who loves Matsuda-sama, who was integral to the textile industry in Hachioji.

name: Awajin
description: A god from Awaji city with the Akashi Kaikyo Bridge on his head.

name: Sacchan
description: A hawk with two children Icchan and Kaichan.  She raises her children in the rich nature of Ichikai.

name: Kakitsubatan
description: A fairy of the kakitsuba flower.  She was born in the Kariya City Special Support School.

name: Nashita
description: A shiitake mushroom with pears for ears

name: Bikki-kun
description: A penguin who is learning to swim.

name: Butsubutsu-kun
description: Two rocky islands with sandstone faces.  Retired due to concerns about offending those with skin problems.

name: Kumamushi-kun and Kumanyanko-chan
description: Kumamushi-kun is a tardigrade and Kumanyanko-chan is a cross between a cat and a tardigrade.

name: Kotochan
description: A dolphin often mistaken for a penguin.  He is the stationmaster for Kotoden-Kotohira station.  He is sometimes seen riding the Kotoden-Kotohira train line with his family.

name: Inzai-kun
description: A drowsy pink rhino.

name: Namisuke and Nammy
description: Namisuke is a puppy sized dinosaur-like fairy with a forest on its back. Nammy is Namisuke's sister and also has a flower on her head.

name: Hamurin
description: Hamurin loves the beauty of Hamura City.  Its head consists of a water drop decorated with a cherry blossom and a body representing the zelkova at Hamura Bridge.  His name badge is held in place by a tulip.

name: Gurandy
description: An eternal three year old deer from Shikaoi.

name: Rini-kun & Rinimane
mascot: Nara City Linear New Station Fan Club
description: Rini-kun is the new Chuo Shinkanesen and Rinimane is its sika deer sidekick from Nara City.  They both wish for a Chuo Shinkansen station in Nara.

name: Chutora
description: The tiger is the zodiac of President Kohei Miura (founder) and best represents the character of the University that has been developing at a remarkable pace.  Chutora loves peaches.

name: Radish Grandpa
description: An old daikon radish born in a field in Ichikawa, Radish Grandpa loves Hakone Gora and hopes for a future that is kind to everyone.

name: MIX
description: A boy hamster born in a mixed juice shop on Kyomise Matsue shopping street.

name: Shinjuku Awawa the superhero soap bubble
mascot: Director of Hand Washing for the Shinjuku Ward Food Sanitation Association
description: A superhero soap bubble meant to teach others about washing their hands properly.

name: Daizo
description: An elephant with a hair style commonly associated with yankee youth, holding an apple.

name: Azumappi
description: A bird mascot for Ageo City Higashimachi Elementary School.  No other description has been found.

name: Ichikawa Misato Rangers (Ninnin, Dondon, Ponpon)
japanese: 市川三郷レンジャー（にんにん・どんどん・ぽんぽん
description: Each character represents a special product from Ichikawa.  Ninnin represents the otsuka carrot, Dondon represents fireworks, and Ponpon represents Ichikawas seal making.

name: The Hashikami Kids
description: The Hashikami Kids consist of Kazemaru (sea urchin), Princess Azalea (azalea flower) and Abramme-kun (an ainame fish).  These are all special products from Hashikami.

name: Yashimon♪
description: A smart and gentle scarecrow who is a bit of a glutton.

name: Nabari no Hiyawan
description: A dog with a Noh mask for a face.

name: Moriyoshi
description: A naughty shiba inu whose favorite food is moriguchizuke, a type of pickled radish.

name: Chibo
description: A young child with an acorn shaped head, he serves as a liason for the Hanado City Children's Association.

name: Hachikazukichan and Neyamarukun
japanese: はちかづきちゃん・ねや丸くん
description: Hachikazuki-chan is based upon the famous folk tale 'Hachikazuki-hime'. Neyamaru-kun is based on the fourth son of the Sanin 3rd Lieutenant General Mincho who appear in the folk tale.

name: Ka-min
description: Often mistaken for a rabbit, Ka-min is a forest fairy with a heart shaped face similar to the land form of Kamikawa.
